TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EmbeddedMailObjectCollectionEditor extends System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor

Docs.summary: Provides a component editor for embedded mail object collections in a object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.EmbeddedMailObjectCollectionEditor> class provides a user interface for editing the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.EmbeddedMailObject> elements of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.EmbeddedMailObjectsCollection> object of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition> objects.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition> objects define the content and format of the email notification messages that are sent by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CreateUserWizard>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery>, and other controls. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.EmbeddedMailObject> elements define the embedded objects within these email messages.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.EmbeddedMailObjectCollectionEditor> is invoked by selecting the ellipsis (**…**) button on the **EmbeddedObjects** property, under **MailDefinition**, in the **Properties** grid of the visual designer.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.EmbeddedMailObjectCollectionEditor.EditValue%2A> method edits the value of the specified object using the specified service provider and context.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Type type) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The of the collection to edit.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.EmbeddedMailObjectCollectionEditor> class when the user selects the ellipsis (**…**) button on the **EmbeddedObjects** property, under **MailDefinition**, in the **Properties** grid of the visual designer, when designing a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CreateUserWizard>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery>, or other control that encapsulates a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition> object.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object EditValue (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, IServiceProvider provider, object value);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance object EditValue(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.IServiceProvider provider, object value) cil managed

public: override System::Object ^ EditValue(System::ComponentModel::ITypeDescriptorContext ^ context, IServiceProvider ^ provider, System::Object ^ value);

Docs.param: An that is used to gain additional context information.
An object implementing the through which editing services can be obtained.
The object to edit the value for.
Docs.summary: Edits the value of the specified object using the specified service provider and context.
Docs.returns: The new ; otherwise, if the value of the object has not changed, unchanged.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.EmbeddedMailObjectCollectionEditor.EditValue%2A> method calls the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext.OnComponentChanging%2A> method of the `context` parameter, and then calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.EmbeddedMailObjectCollectionEditor.EditValue%2A> base method. Exceptions that are thrown are propagated back to the caller. The <xref:System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext.OnComponentChanged%2A> method of `context` is called when the editing is complete.
